file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-12-07 - CONFIG-1 - FLOOR PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHTS - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLOOR PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHTS - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PHOTOLUMINESCENT STRIP LIGHTS 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Lights. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMI- PHOTOLUMINESCENT 33-50-12-100-801-A TY STRIP LIGHTS - CLEANING STRIP LIGHTS EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 33-50-12 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-12-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PHOTOLUMINESCENT STRIP LIGHTS 2. PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHTS - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Lights. (2) It is not necessary to remove the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light to clean the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light top cover. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-12-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-50-12-400-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 231 Passenger cabin 232 Passenger cabin 241 Passenger cabin 242 Passenger cabin 251 Passenger cabin 252 Passenger cabin 261 Passenger cabin 262 Passenger cabin D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-1 33-50-12 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Lights - Cleaning (Figure 701) SUBTASK 160-007-B CAUTION: • DO NOT USE ALKALIS, AMINES, AROMATIC HYDROCARBONS, ESTERS, HALOGENATED HYDROCARBONS OR KETONES. THESE CHEMICALS CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHT. • DO NOT USE ABRASIVE MATERIAL TO CLEAN THE TOP COVER OF THE PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHT. THE ABRASIVE MATERIAL CAN CAUSE SCRATCHES IN THE TOP COVER. (1) NOTE: The use of naphtha (VM&P or similar) product is permitted, if you do not cause prolonged exposure or soaking. (FOR AIRCRAFT WITH PROTECTION TOP COVER) To clean the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light, do as follows: (a) Use a weak detergent-and-water solution to clean the top cover (1) of the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light. (b) To clean the photoluminescent element (3) of the Photoluminescent Floor- Proximity Strip Light, do as follows: 1 Remove the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light (AMM TASK 33-50-12-000-802-A/400). 2 Remove the end cap (2) of the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light. 3 Remove the photoluminescent element (3). CAUTION: DO NOT USE SOLVENTS, PETROLEUM-BASED PRODUCTS OR CHEMICALS THAT CAN CAUSE CORROSION TO THE BASE METAL (ALUMINUM). IF YOU USE THESE PRODUCTS, DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO THE PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHT. 4 Use a weak detergent-and-water solution to clean the photoluminescent element (3) of the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light. 5 Put the photoluminescent element (3) into the open end of the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light segment. 6 Move the photoluminescent element (3) into Photoluminescent Floor- Proximity Strip Light segment. 7 Install the end cap (2). 8 Install the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light segment on the floor panel (AMM TASK 33-50-12-400-802-A/400). (2) (FOR AIRCRAFT WITHOUT PROTECTION TOP COVER) To cleaning the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light, do as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-1 33-50-12 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Remove the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light (AMM TASK 33-50-12-000-802-A/400). CAUTION:DO NOT USE SOLVENTS, PETROLEUM-BASED PRODUCTS OR CHEMICALS THAT CAN CAUSE CORROSION TO THE BASE METAL (ALUMINUM). IF YOU USE THESE PRODUCTS, DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO THE PHOTOLUMINESCENT FLOOR-PROXIMITY STRIP LIGHT. (b) Use a weak detergent-and-water solution to clean the photoluminescent element (3) of the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light. (c) Install the Photoluminescent Floor-Proximity Strip Light segment on the floor panel (AMM TASK 33-50-12-400-802-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-1 33-50-12 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
